00140 #define EQUIPMENT_COMMON_STR "\
00141 Event ID = WORD : 0\n\
00142 Trigger mask = WORD : 0\n\
00143 Buffer = STRING : [32] SYSTEM\n\
00144 Type = INT : 0\n\
00145 Source = INT : 0\n\
00146 Format = STRING : [8] FIXED\n\
00147 Enabled = BOOL : 0\n\
00148 Read on = INT : 0\n\
00149 Period = INT : 0\n\
00150 Event limit = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00151 Num subevents = DWORD : 0\n\
00152 Log history = INT : 0\n\
00153 Frontend host = STRING : [32] \n\
00154 Frontend name = STRING : [32] \n\
00155 Frontend file name = STRING : [256] \n\
00156 "
00157 
00158 #define EQUIPMENT_STATISTICS_STR "\
00159 Events sent = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00160 Events per sec. = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00161 kBytes per sec. = DOUBLE : 0\n\
00162 "

00164 /********************************************************************/
00165 INT register_equipment(void)
00166 {
00167   INT index, size, status;
00168   char str[256];
00169   EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00170   EQUIPMENT_STATS *eq_stats;
00171   HNDLE hKey;
00172 
00173   /* get current ODB run state */
00174   size = sizeof(run_state);
00175   run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00176   db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/State", &run_state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
00177   size = sizeof(run_number);
00178   run_number = 1;
00179   status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
00180   assert(status == SUCCESS);
00181 
00182   /* scan EQUIPMENT table from mevb.C */
00183   for (index = 0; equipment[index].name[0]; index++) {
00184     eq_info = &equipment[index].info;
00185     eq_stats = &equipment[index].stats;
00186 
00187     if (eq_info->event_id == 0) {
00188       printf("\nEvent ID 0 for %s not allowed\n", equipment[index].name);
00189       cm_disconnect_experiment();
00190       ss_sleep(5000);
00191       exit(0);
00192     }
00193 
00194     /* init status */
00195     equipment[index].status = EB_SUCCESS;
00196 
00197     sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Common", equipment[index].name);
00198 
00199     /* get last event limit from ODB */
00200     if (eq_info->eq_type != EQ_SLOW) {
00201       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00202       size = sizeof(double);
00203       if (hKey)
00204         db_get_value(hDB, hKey, "Event limit", &eq_info->event_limit, &size,
00205         TID_DOUBLE, TRUE);
00206     }
00207 
00208     /* Create common subtree */
00209     status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, EQUIPMENT_COMMON_STR, TRUE);
00210     if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00211       printf("Cannot check equipment record, status = %d\n", status);
00212       ss_sleep(3000);
00213     }
00214     db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00215 
00216     if (equal_ustring(eq_info->format, "YBOS"))
00217       equipment[index].format = FORMAT_YBOS;
00218     else if (equal_ustring(eq_info->format, "FIXED"))
00219       equipment[index].format = FORMAT_FIXED;
00220     else    /* default format is MIDAS */
00221       equipment[index].format = FORMAT_MIDAS;
00222 
00223     gethostname(eq_info->frontend_host, sizeof(eq_info->frontend_host));
00224     strcpy(eq_info->frontend_name, full_frontend_name);
00225     strcpy(eq_info->frontend_file_name, frontend_file_name);
00226 
00227     /* set record from equipment[] table in frontend.c */
00228     db_set_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO), 0);
00229 
00230     /* get record once at the start equipment info */
00231     size = sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO);
00232     db_get_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, &size, 0);
00233 
00234     /*---- Create just the key , leave it empty ---------------------------------*/
00235     sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Variables", equipment[index].name);
00236     db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
00237     db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00238     equipment[index].hkey_variables = hKey;
00239 
00240     /*---- Create and initialize statistics tree -------------------*/
00241     sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Statistics", equipment[index].name);
00242 
00243     status = db_check_record(hDB, 0, str, EQUIPMENT_STATISTICS_STR, TRUE);
00244     if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00245       printf("Cannot create/check statistics record, error %d\n", status);
00246       ss_sleep(3000);
00247     }
00248 
00249     status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00250     if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00251       printf("Cannot find statistics record, error %d\n", status);
00252       ss_sleep(3000);
00253     }
00254 
00255     eq_stats->events_sent = 0;
00256     eq_stats->events_per_sec = 0;
00257     eq_stats->kbytes_per_sec = 0;
00258 
00259     /* open hot link to statistics tree */
00260     status = db_open_record(hDB, hKey, eq_stats, sizeof(EQUIPMENT_STATS)
00261       , MODE_WRITE, NULL, NULL);
00262     if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00263       cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment", 
00264         "Cannot open statistics record, error %d. Probably other FE is using it",
00265         status);
00266       ss_sleep(3000);
00267     }
00268 
00269     /*---- open event buffer ---------------------------------------*/
00270     if (eq_info->buffer[0]) {
00271       status = bm_open_buffer(eq_info->buffer, EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE,
00272         &equipment[index].buffer_handle);
00273       if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
00274         cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment",
00275           "Cannot open event buffer. Try to reduce EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE in midas.h \
00276           and rebuild the system.");
00277         return 0;
00278       }
00279 
00280       /* set the default buffer cache size */
00281       bm_set_cache_size(equipment[index].buffer_handle, 0, SERVER_CACHE_SIZE);
00282     } else {
00283       cm_msg(MERROR, "register_equipment", "Destination buffer must be present");
00284       ss_sleep(3000);
00285       exit(0);
00286     }
00287   }
00288   return SUCCESS;
00289 }
00290 
00291 /********************************************************************/
00292 INT load_fragment(void)
00293 {
00294   INT i, size, type;
00295   BOOL enabled;
00296   HNDLE hEqKey, hSubkey;
00297   EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00298   KEY  key;
00299   char  buffer[NAME_LENGTH];
00300   char  format[8];
00301 
00302   /* Get equipment pointer, only one eqp for now */
00303   eq_info = &equipment[0].info;
00304 
00305   /* Scan Equipment/Common listing */
00306   if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "Equipment", &hEqKey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00307     cm_msg(MINFO, "load_fragment", "Equipment listing not found");
00308     return EB_ERROR;
00309   }
00310 
00311   /* Scan the Equipment list for fragment info collection */
00312   for (i = 0, nfragment=0 ; ; i++) {
00313     db_enum_key(hDB, hEqKey, i, &hSubkey);
00314     if (!hSubkey)
00315       break;
00316     db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
00317     if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
00318       /* Equipment name */
00319       if (debug) printf("Equipment name:%s\n", key.name);
00320       /* Check if equipment is EQ_EB */
00321       size = sizeof(INT);
00322       db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/type", &type, &size, TID_INT, 0);
00323       size = sizeof(buffer);
00324       db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Buffer", buffer, &size, TID_STRING, 0);
00325       size = sizeof(format);
00326       db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Format", format, &size, TID_STRING, 0);
00327       size = sizeof(BOOL);
00328       enabled = FALSE;
00329       db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Settings/Enabled", &enabled, &size, TID_BOOL, 0);
00330       /* Check if equipment match EB requirements */
00331       if ((type & EQ_EB) && enabled 
00332         && (strncmp(buffer, buffer_name, strlen(buffer_name)) == 0)
00333         && (strncmp(format, eq_info->format, strlen(format)) == 0)) {
00334           /* match=> fill internal eb structure */
00335           strcpy(ebch[nfragment].format, format);
00336           strcpy(ebch[nfragment].buffer, buffer);
00337           size = sizeof(WORD);
00338           db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Trigger Mask", &ebch[nfragment].trigger_mask, &size, TID_WORD, 0);
00339           size = sizeof(WORD);
00340           db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "common/Event ID", &ebch[nfragment].event_id, &size, TID_WORD, 0);
00341           printf("%s enabled\n",key.name);
00342           nfragment++;
00343         }
00344     }
00345   }
00346 
00347   printf("Found %d fragment matching EB setting\n", nfragment);
00348   /* Point to the Ebuilder settings */
00349   /* Set fragment_add function based on the format */
00350   if (equipment[0].format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00351     meb_fragment_add = eb_mfragment_add;
00352   else if (equipment[0].format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00353     meb_fragment_add = eb_yfragment_add;
00354   else {
00355     cm_msg(MERROR, "mevb", "Unknown data format :%d", format);
00356     return EB_ERROR;
00357   }
00358 
00359   /* allocate destination event buffer */
00360   dest_event = (char *) malloc(nfragment * (max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)));
00361   memset(dest_event, 0, nfragment * (max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)));
00362   if (dest_event == NULL) {
00363     cm_msg(MERROR, "EBuilder", "%s: Not enough memory for event buffer", full_frontend_name);
00364     return EB_ERROR;
00365   }
00366   return EB_SUCCESS;
00367 }
00368 
00369 /********************************************************************/
00370 INT scan_fragment(void)
00371 {
00372   INT fragn, status;
00373   EQUIPMENT *eq;
00374   EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00375 
00376   /* Get equipment pointer, only one eqp for now */
00377   eq_info = &equipment[0].info;
00378 
00379   /* Main event loop */
00380   do {
00381     switch (run_state) {
00382       case STATE_STOPPED:
00383       case STATE_PAUSED:
00384         /* skip the source scan and yield */
00385         status = cm_yield(500);
00386         if (wheel) {
00387           printf("...%c Snoring\r", bars[i_bar++ % 4]);
00388           fflush(stdout);
00389         }
00390         break;
00391       case STATE_RUNNING:
00392         status = source_scan(equipment[0].format, eq_info);
00393         switch (status) {
00394             case BM_ASYNC_RETURN:  // No event found for now, Check for timeout 
00395               for (fragn = 0; fragn < nfragment; fragn++) {
00396                 if (ebch[fragn].timeout > TIMEOUT) {        /* Timeout */
00397                   if (stop_requested) {                     /* Stop */
00398                     if (debug) printf("Stop requested on timeout %d\n", status);
00399                       status = close_buffers();
00400                     break;
00401                   } 
00402                   else {         /* No stop requested  but timeout */
00403                     if (wheel) {
00404                       printf("...%c Timoing on %1.0lf\r", bars[i_bar++ % 4],
00405                         eq->stats.events_sent);
00406                       fflush(stdout);
00407                       status = cm_yield(50);
00408                     }
00409                   }
00410                 }
00411                 //else { /* No timeout loop back */
00412               } // for loop over all fragments
00413               break;
00414             case EB_ERROR:
00415             case EB_USER_ERROR:
00416               abort_requested = TRUE;
00417               if (status == EB_USER_ERROR)
00418                 cm_msg(MTALK, "EBuilder", "%s: Error signaled by user code - stopping run...", full_frontend_name);
00419               else
00420                 cm_msg(MTALK, "EBuilder", "%s: Event mismatch - Stopping run...", full_frontend_name);
00421               if (cm_transition(TR_STOP, 0, NULL, 0, ASYNC, 0) != CM_SUCCESS) {
00422                 cm_msg(MERROR, "EBuilder", "%s: Stop Transition request failed", full_frontend_name);
00423                 status = close_buffers();
00424                 return status;
00425               }
00426               if (debug) printf("Stop requested on Error %d\n", status);
00427               status = close_buffers();
00428               return status;
00429               break;
00430             case EB_SUCCESS:
00431             case EB_SKIP:
00432               //   Normal path if event has been assembled
00433               //   No yield in this case.
00434               break;
00435             default:
00436               cm_msg(MERROR, "Source_scan", "unexpected return %d", status);
00437               status = SS_ABORT;
00438               }  // switch scan_source
00439         break;
00440     }
00441     /* EB job done, update statistics if its time */
00442     /* Check if it's time to do statistics job */
00443     if ((actual_millitime = ss_millitime()) - last_time > 1000) {
00444       /* Force event to appear at the destination if Ebuilder is remote */
00445       rpc_flush_event();
00446       /* Force event ot appear at the destination if Ebuilder is local */
00447       bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, ASYNC);
00448 
00449       status = cm_yield(10);
00450 
00451       eq = &equipment[0];
00452       eq->stats.events_sent += eq->events_sent;
00453       eq->stats.events_per_sec =
00454         eq->events_sent / ((actual_millitime - last_time) / 1000.0);
00455       eq->stats.kbytes_per_sec =
00456         eq->bytes_sent / 1024.0 / ((actual_millitime - last_time) /
00457         1000.0);
00458       eq->bytes_sent = 0;
00459       eq->events_sent = 0;
00460       /* update destination statistics */
00461       db_send_changed_records();
00462       /* Keep track of last ODB update */
00463       last_time = ss_millitime();
00464     }
00465   } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
00466 
00467   return status;
00468   }
00469 
00470 /********************************************************************/
00471 INT eb_mfragment_add(char *pdest, char *psrce, INT * size)
00472 {
00473    BANK_HEADER *psbh, *pdbh;
00474    char *psdata, *pddata;
00475    INT bksize;
00476 
00477    /* Condition for new EVENT the data_size should be ZERO */
00478    *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00479 
00480    /* destination pointer */
00481    pddata = pdest + *size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00482 
00483    if (*size) {
00484       /* NOT the first fragment */
00485 
00486       /* Swap event source if necessary */
00487       psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00488       bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
00489 
00490       /* source pointer */
00491       psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00492       psdata = (char *) (psbh + 1);
00493 
00494       /* copy all banks without the bank header */
00495       bksize = psbh->data_size;
00496 
00497       /* copy */
00498       memcpy(pddata, psdata, bksize);
00499 
00500       /* update event size */
00501       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += bksize;
00502 
00503       /* update bank size */
00504       pdbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest) + 1);
00505       pdbh->data_size += bksize;
00506 
00507       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00508    } else {
00509       /* First event without the event header but with the 
00510          bank header as the size is zero */
00511       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce)->data_size;
00512 
00513       /* Swap event if necessary */
00514       psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00515       bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
00516 
00517       /* copy first fragment */
00518       memcpy(pddata, psbh, *size);
00519 
00520       /* update destination event size */
00521       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size = *size;
00522    }
00523    return CM_SUCCESS;
00524 }
00525 
00526 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00527 INT eb_yfragment_add(char *pdest, char *psrce, INT * size)
00528 {
00529    /* pdest : EVENT_HEADER pointer
00530       psrce : EVENT_HEADER pointer
00531       Keep pbkh for later incrementation
00532     */
00533    char *psdata, *pddata;
00534    DWORD *pslrl, *pdlrl;
00535    INT i4frgsize, i1frgsize, status;
00536 
00537    /* Condition for new EVENT the data_size should be ZERO */
00538    *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00539 
00540    /* destination pointer skip the header as it has been already
00541       composed and the usere may have modified it on purpose (Midas Control) */
00542    pddata = pdest + *size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00543 
00544    /* the Midas header is present for logger */
00545    if (*size) {                 /* already filled with a fragment */
00546 
00547       /* source pointer: number of DWORD (lrl included) */
00548       pslrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00549 
00550       /* Swap event if necessary */
00551       status = ybos_event_swap(pslrl);
00552 
00553       /* copy done in bytes, do not include LRL */
00554       psdata = (char *) (pslrl + 1);
00555 
00556       /* copy size in I*4 (lrl included, remove it) */
00557       i4frgsize = (*pslrl);
00558       i1frgsize = 4 * i4frgsize;
00559 
00560       /* append fragment */
00561       memcpy(pddata, psdata, i1frgsize);
00562 
00563       /* update Midas header event size */
00564       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += i1frgsize;
00565 
00566       /* update LRL size (I*4) */
00567       pdlrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest) + 1);
00568       *pdlrl += i4frgsize;
00569 
00570       /* Return event size in bytes */
00571       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00572    } else {                     /* new destination event */
00573       /* The composed event has already the MIDAS header.
00574          which may have been modified by the user in ebuser.c
00575          Will be stripped by the logger (YBOS).
00576          Copy the first full event ( no EVID suppression )
00577          First event (without the event header) */
00578 
00579       /* source pointer */
00580       pslrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00581 
00582       /* Swap event if necessary */
00583       status = ybos_event_swap(pslrl);
00584 
00585       /* size in byte from the source midas header */
00586       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce)->data_size;
00587 
00588       /* copy first fragment */
00589       memcpy(pddata, (char *) pslrl, *size);
00590 
00591       /* update destination Midas header event size */
00592       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += *size;
00593 
00594    }
00595    return CM_SUCCESS;
00596 }
00597 
00598 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00599 INT tr_start(INT rn, char *error)
00600 {
00601   EBUILDER(ebuilder_str);
00602   INT status, size, i;
00603   char   str[128];
00604   KEY    key;
00605   HNDLE  hKey, hEqkey, hEqFRkey;
00606   EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info;
00607   
00608 
00609   eq_info = &equipment[0].info;
00610 
00611   /* Get update eq_info from ODB */
00612   sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Common", equipment[0].name);
00613   status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
00614   size = sizeof(EQUIPMENT_INFO);
00615   db_get_record(hDB, hKey, eq_info, &size, 0);
00616 
00617   ebset.nfragment = nfragment;
00618 
00619   /* reset serial numbers */
00620   for (i = 0; equipment[i].name[0]; i++) {
00621     equipment[i].serial_number = 1;
00622     equipment[i].subevent_number = 0;
00623     equipment[i].stats.events_sent = 0;
00624     equipment[i].odb_in = equipment[i].odb_out = 0;
00625   }
00626 
00627   /* Get / Set Settings */
00628   sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Settings", equipment[0].name);
00629   if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hEqkey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00630     status = db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(ebuilder_str));
00631   }
00632 
00633   /* Keep Key on Ebuilder/Settings */
00634   sprintf(str, "/Equipment/%s/Settings", equipment[0].name);
00635   if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hEqkey) != DB_SUCCESS) {
00636     cm_msg(MINFO, "load_fragment", "/Equipment/%s/Settings not found", equipment[0].name);
00637   }
00638   
00639   /* Update or Create User_field */
00640   size = sizeof(ebset.user_field);
00641   status = db_get_value(hDB, hEqkey, "User Field", ebset.user_field, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00642 
00643   /* Update or Create User_Build */
00644   size = sizeof(ebset.user_build);
00645   status = db_get_value(hDB, hEqkey, "User Build", &ebset.user_build, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
00646 
00647   /* update ODB */
00648   size = sizeof(INT);
00649   status = db_set_value(hDB, hEqkey, "Number of Fragment", &ebset.nfragment, size, 1, TID_INT);  
00650 
00651     /* Create or update the fragment request list */
00652   status = db_find_key(hDB, hEqkey, "Fragment Required", &hEqFRkey);
00653   status = db_get_key (hDB, hEqFRkey, &key);
00654   if (key.num_values != ebset.nfragment) {
00655     cm_msg(MINFO, "mevb", "Number of Fragment mismatch ODB:%d - CUR:%d", key.num_values, ebset.nfragment);
00656     free (ebset.preqfrag);
00657     size = ebset.nfragment*sizeof(BOOL);
00658     ebset.preqfrag = (BOOL *) malloc(size);
00659     for (i=0 ; i<ebset.nfragment ; i++)
00660       ebset.preqfrag[i] = TRUE;
00661     status = db_set_value(hDB, hEqkey, "Fragment Required", ebset.preqfrag, size, ebset.nfragment, TID_BOOL);  
00662   } else {  // Take from ODBedit
00663     size = key.total_size;
00664     free (ebset.preqfrag);
00665     ebset.preqfrag = (BOOL *) malloc(size);
00666     status = db_get_data(hDB, hEqFRkey, ebset.preqfrag, &size, TID_BOOL);
00667   }
00668   /* Cleanup fragment flags */
00669   free (ebset.received);
00670   ebset.received = (BOOL *) malloc(size);
00671   for (i=0 ; i < ebset.nfragment ; i++) 
00672     ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
00673 
00674   /* Call BOR user function */
00675   status = eb_begin_of_run(run_number, ebset.user_field, error);
00676   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
00677     cm_msg(MERROR, "eb_prestart", "run start aborted due to eb_begin_of_run (%d)",
00678       status);
00679     return status;
00680   }
00681 
00682   /* Book all fragment */
00683   status = source_booking();
00684   if (status != SUCCESS)
00685     return status;
00686 
00687   /* local run state */
00688   run_state = STATE_RUNNING;
00689   run_number = rn;
00690   stop_requested = FALSE;
00691   abort_requested = FALSE;
00692   printf("%s-Starting New Run: %d\n", full_frontend_name, rn);
00693 
00694   /* Reset global trigger mask */
00695   return CM_SUCCESS;
00696 }
00697 
00698 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00699 INT tr_stop(INT rn, char *error)
00700 {
00701    printf("\n%s-Stopping Run: %d detected\n", full_frontend_name, rn);
00702 
00703    /* local stop */
00704    stop_requested = TRUE;
00705 
00706    /* local stop time */
00707    request_stop_time = ss_millitime();
00708    return CM_SUCCESS;
00709 }
00710 
00711 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00712 void free_event_buffer(INT nfrag)
00713 {
00714    INT i;
00715    for (i = 0; i < nfrag; i++) {
00716       if (ebch[i].pfragment) {
00717          free(ebch[i].pfragment);
00718          ebch[i].pfragment = NULL;
00719       }
00720    }
00721 }
00722 
00723 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00724 INT handFlush()
00725 {
00726    int i, size, status;
00727    char strout[256];
00728 
00729    /* Do Hand flush until better way to  garantee the input buffer to be empty */
00730    if (debug)
00731       printf("Hand flushing system buffer... \n");
00732    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00733       do {
00734          size = max_event_size;
00735          status = bm_receive_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].pfragment, &size, ASYNC);
00736          if (debug1) {
00737             sprintf(strout,
00738                     "booking:Hand flush bm_receive_event[%d] hndle:%d stat:%d  Last Ser:%d",
00739                     i, ebch[i].hBuf, status,
00740                     ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number);
00741             printf("%s\n", strout);
00742          }
00743       } while (status == BM_SUCCESS);
00744    }
00745 
00746    /* Empty source buffer */
00747    status = bm_empty_buffers();
00748    if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
00749       cm_msg(MERROR, "handFlush", "bm_empty_buffers failure [%d]", status);
00750    run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00751    return status;
00752 }
00753 
00754 
00755 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00756 INT source_booking()
00757 {
00758    INT j, i, status, status1, status2;
00759 
00760    if (debug)
00761       printf("Entering booking\n");
00762 
00763    /* Book all the source channels */
00764    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00765       /* Book only the requested event mask */
00766      if (ebset.preqfrag[i]) {
00767          /* Connect channel to source buffer */
00768          status1 = bm_open_buffer(ebch[i].buffer, EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE, &(ebch[i].hBuf));
00769 
00770          if (debug)
00771            printf("bm_open_buffer frag:%d buf:%s handle:%d stat:%d\n",
00772                    i, ebch[i].buffer, ebch[i].hBuf, status1);
00773          /* Register for specified channel event ID and Trigger mask */
00774          status2 =
00775              bm_request_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].event_id,
00776                               ebch[i].trigger_mask, GET_ALL, &ebch[i].req_id, NULL);
00777          if (debug)
00778            printf("bm_request_event frag:%d id:%d msk:%d req_id:%d stat:%d\n",
00779                    i, ebch[i].event_id, ebch[i].trigger_mask, ebch[i].req_id, status2);
00780          if (((status1 != BM_SUCCESS) && (status1 != BM_CREATED)) ||
00781              ((status2 != BM_SUCCESS) && (status2 != BM_CREATED))) {
00782             cm_msg(MERROR, "source_booking",
00783                    "Open buffer/event request failure [%d %d %d]", i, status1, status2);
00784             return BM_CONFLICT;
00785          }
00786 
00787          /* allocate local source event buffer */
00788          if (ebch[i].pfragment)
00789             free(ebch[i].pfragment);
00790          ebch[i].pfragment = (char *) malloc(max_event_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
00791          if (debug)
00792             printf("malloc pevent frag:%d pevent:%p\n", i, ebch[i].pfragment);
00793          if (ebch[i].pfragment == NULL) {
00794             free_event_buffer(nfragment);
00795             cm_msg(MERROR, "source_booking", "Can't allocate space for buffer");
00796             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
00797          }
00798       }
00799    }
00800 
00801    /* Empty source buffer */
00802    status = bm_empty_buffers();
00803    if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
00804       cm_msg(MERROR, "source_booking", "bm_empty_buffers failure [%d]", status);
00805       return status;
00806    }
00807 
00808    if (debug) {
00809       printf("bm_empty_buffers stat:%d\n", status);
00810       for (j = 0; j < ebset.nfragment; j++) {
00811          printf(" buff:%s", ebch[j].buffer);
00812          printf(" ser#:%d", ebch[j].serial);
00813          printf(" hbuf:%2d", ebch[j].hBuf);
00814          printf(" rqid:%2d", ebch[j].req_id);
00815          printf(" opst:%d", status1);
00816          printf(" rqst:%d", status2);
00817          printf(" evid:%2d", ebch[j].event_id);
00818          printf(" tmsk:0x%4.4x\n", ebch[j].trigger_mask);
00819       }
00820    }
00821 
00822    return SUCCESS;
00823 }
00824 
00825 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00826 INT source_unbooking()
00827 {
00828    INT i, status;
00829 
00830 #if 0
00831    /* Skip unbooking if already done */
00832    if (ebch[0].pfragment == NULL)
00833       return EB_SUCCESS;
00834 #endif
00835 
00836    /* unbook all source channels */
00837    for (i = 0; i< nfragment; i++) {
00838       bm_empty_buffers();
00839 
00840       if (ebch[i].trigger_mask) {
00841         /* Remove event ID registration */
00842         status = bm_delete_request(ebch[i].req_id);
00843         if (debug)
00844            printf("unbook: bm_delete_req[%d] req_id:%d stat:%d\n", i, ebch[i].req_id,
00845                   status);
00846 
00847         /* Close source buffer */
00848         status = bm_close_buffer(ebch[i].hBuf);
00849         if (debug)
00850            printf("unbook: bm_close_buffer[%d] hndle:%d stat:%d\n", i, ebch[i].hBuf,
00851                   status);
00852         if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
00853            cm_msg(MERROR, "source_unbooking", "Close buffer[%d] stat:", i, status);
00854            return status;
00855         }
00856      }
00857    }
00858 
00859    /* release local event buffer memory */
00860    free_event_buffer(nfragment);
00861 
00862    return EB_SUCCESS;
00863 }
00864 
00865 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00866 INT close_buffers(void)
00867 {
00868   INT status;
00869   char error[256];
00870   EQUIPMENT *eq;
00871 
00872   eq = &equipment[0];
00873 
00874   /* Flush local destination cache */
00875   bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, SYNC);
00876   /* Call user function */
00877   eb_end_of_run(run_number, error);
00878   /* Cleanup buffers */
00879   handFlush();
00880   /* Detach all source from midas */
00881   status = source_unbooking();
00882 
00883   /* Compose message */
00884   stop_time = ss_millitime() - request_stop_time;
00885   sprintf(error, "Run %d Stop after %1.0lf events sent DT:%d[ms]",
00886     run_number, eq->stats.events_sent, stop_time);
00887   cm_msg(MINFO, "EBuilder", "%s", error);
00888 
00889   run_state = STATE_STOPPED;
00890   abort_requested = FALSE;
00891   return status;
00892 }
00893 
00894 /********************************************************************/
00916 INT source_scan(INT fmt, EQUIPMENT_INFO *eq_info)
00917 {
00918 //   static char bars[] = "|/-\\";
00919 //   static int i_bar;
00920    static DWORD serial;
00921    DWORD *plrl;
00922    BOOL   complete;
00923    INT i, j, status, size;
00924    INT act_size;
00925    BOOL found, event_mismatch;
00926    BANK_HEADER *psbh;
00927    BOOL got_a_fragment;
00928 
00929    status = SUCCESS;
00930    got_a_fragment = FALSE;
00931 
00932    /* Scan all channels at least once */
00933    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00934       /* Check if current channel needs to be received */
00935      if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && !ebset.received[i]) {
00936          /* Get fragment and store it in ebch[i].pfragment */
00937          size = max_event_size;
00938          status = bm_receive_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].pfragment, &size, ASYNC);
00939          switch (status) {
00940          case BM_SUCCESS:      /* event received */
00941             /* Mask event */
00942             ebset.received[i] = TRUE;
00943             /* Keep local serial */
00944             ebch[i].serial = ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number;
00945             got_a_fragment = TRUE;
00946 
00947             /* Swap event depending on data format */
00948             switch (fmt) {
00949             case FORMAT_YBOS:
00950                plrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment) + 1);
00951                ybos_event_swap(plrl);
00952                break;
00953             case FORMAT_MIDAS:
00954                psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment) + 1);
00955                bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
00956                break;
00957             }
00958 
00959             if (debug1) {
00960               printf("SUCC: ch:%d ser:%d rec:%d sz:%d\n", i,
00961                       ebch[i].serial, ebset.received[i], size);
00962             }
00963             break;
00964          case BM_ASYNC_RETURN: /* timeout */
00965             ebch[i].timeout++;
00966             if (debug1) {
00967 //              printf("ASYNC: ch:%d ser:%d rec:%d sz:%d\n", i,
00968 //                      ebch[i].serial, ebset.received[i], size);
00969             }
00970             break;
00971          default:              /* Error */
00972             cm_msg(MERROR, "event_scan", "bm_receive_event error %d", status);
00973             return status;
00974             break;
00975          }
00976       }    /* next channel */
00977    }
00978 
00979 
00980    /* Check if all fragments have been received */
00981    complete = FALSE;
00982    for (i = 0; i < nfragment;i++) {
00983      if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && !ebset.received[i])
00984        break;
00985    }
00986    if (i == nfragment) {
00987      complete = TRUE;
00988      /* Check if serial matches */
00989      found = event_mismatch = FALSE;
00990      /* Check Serial, mark first serial */
00991      for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00992          if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && ebset.received[i] && !found) {
00993             serial = ebch[i].serial;
00994             found = TRUE;
00995          } else {
00996             if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && ebset.received[i] && (serial != ebch[i].serial)) {
00997                /* Event mismatch */
00998                event_mismatch = TRUE;
00999             }
01000          }
01001       }
01002 
01003     /* internal action in case of event mismatch */
01004      if (event_mismatch && debug) {
01005        char str[256];
01006        char strsub[128];
01007        strcpy(str, "event mismatch: ");
01008        for (j = 0; j < nfragment; j++) {
01009          sprintf(strsub, "Ser[%d]:%d ", j, ebch[j].serial);
01010          strcat(str, strsub);
01011        }
01012        printf("event serial mismatch %s\n", str);
01013      }
01014 
01015      /* In any case reset destination buffer */
01016      memset(dest_event, 0, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01017      act_size = 0;
01018 
01019      /* Fill reserved header space of destination event with
01020      final header information */
01021      bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event, eq_info->event_id, eq_info->trigger_mask,
01022        act_size, ebch[0].serial);
01023 
01024      /* Pass fragments to user with mismatch flag, for final check before assembly */
01025      status = eb_user(nfragment, event_mismatch, ebch
01026        , (EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event,(void *) ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event + 1), &act_size);
01027      if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01028        if (status == EB_SKIP) {
01029          /* Reset mask and timeouts as even thave been succesfully send */
01030          for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01031            ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01032            ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
01033          }
01034        }
01035        return status;        // Event mark as EB_SKIP or EB_ABORT by user
01036      }
01037 
01038      /* Overall event to be sent */
01039      act_size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01040 
01041      /* Allow bypass of fragment assembly if user did it on its own */
01042      if (!ebset.user_build) {
01043        for (j = 0; j < nfragment; j++) {
01044          if (ebch[j].trigger_mask) {
01045            status = meb_fragment_add(dest_event, ebch[j].pfragment, &act_size);
01046            if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01047              cm_msg(MERROR, "source_scan",
01048                "compose fragment:%d current size:%d (%d)", j, act_size, status);
01049              return EB_ERROR;
01050            }
01051          }
01052        }
01053      }
01054 
01055      /* Overall event to be sent */
01056      act_size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01057 
01058      /* Send event and wait for completion */
01059      status = rpc_send_event(equipment[0].buffer_handle, dest_event, act_size, SYNC);
01060      if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01061        if (debug)
01062          printf("rpc_send_event returned error %d, event_size %d\n",
01063          status, act_size);
01064        cm_msg(MERROR, "EBuilder", "%s: rpc_send_event returned error %d", full_frontend_name, status);
01065        return EB_ERROR;
01066      }
01067 
01068      /* Keep track of the total byte count */
01069      equipment[0].bytes_sent += act_size;
01070 
01071      /* update destination event count */
01072      equipment[0].events_sent++;
01073 
01074      /* Reset mask and timeouts as even thave been succesfully send */
01075      for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01076        ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01077        ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
01078      }
01079    } // all fragment recieved for this event
01080 
01081    // If we did not receive any fragments, then take a break and let the 
01082    // CPU get some other work done.  The "stop_requested" condition protects
01083    // against a race between the end of one run and the start of the next.
01084    if(!got_a_fragment && !stop_requested) {
01085      cm_yield(10);
01086    }
01087 
01088    return status;
01089 }
01090 
01091 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01092 int main(unsigned int argc, char **argv)
01093 {
01094   INT status;
01095   unsigned int i;
01096   BOOL daemon = FALSE;
01097   
01098   /* init structure */
01099   memset(&ebch[0], 0, sizeof(ebch));
01100 
01101   /* set default */
01102   cm_get_environment(host_name, sizeof(host_name), expt_name, sizeof(expt_name));
01103 
01104   /* get parameters */
01105   for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
01106     if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd') {
01107       debug = TRUE;
01108       debug1 = TRUE;
01109     }
01110     else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'D')
01111       daemon = TRUE;
01112     else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'w')
01113       wheel = TRUE;
01114     else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
01115       if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
01116         goto usage;
01117       if (strncmp(argv[i], "-e", 2) == 0)
01118         strcpy(expt_name, argv[++i]);
01119       else if (strncmp(argv[i], "-h", 2) == 0)
01120         strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
01121       else if (strncmp(argv[i], "-b", 2) == 0)
01122         strcpy(buffer_name, argv[++i]);
01123     } else {
01124 usage:
01125       printf("usage: mevb [-h <Hostname>] [-e <Experiment>] -b <buffername> [-d debug]\n");
01126       printf("             -w show wheel -D to start as a daemon\n\n");
01127       return 0;
01128     }
01129   }
01130 
01131   printf("Program mevb version 5 started\n\n");
01132   if (daemon) {
01133     printf("Becoming a daemon...\n");
01134     ss_daemon_init(FALSE);
01135   }
01136 
01137   /* Check buffer arg */
01138   if (buffer_name[0] == 0) {
01139     printf("Buffer name must be specified with -b argument\n");
01140     goto exit;
01141   }
01142 
01143   /* Compose frontend name */
01144    strcpy(full_frontend_name, frontend_name);
01145 
01146   /* Connect to experiment */
01147   status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, expt_name, full_frontend_name, NULL);
01148   if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
01149     ss_sleep(5000);
01150     goto exit;
01151   }
01152 
01153   if (debug)
01154     cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, 0);
01155 
01156   /* Connect to ODB */
01157   status = cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
01158   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01159     ss_sleep(5000);
01160     goto exit;
01161   }
01162   
01163   /* check if Ebuilder is already running */
01164   status = cm_exist(full_frontend_name, TRUE);
01165   if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
01166     cm_msg(MERROR, "Ebuilder", "%s running already!.", full_frontend_name);
01167     cm_disconnect_experiment();
01168     goto exit;
01169   }
01170 
01171   if (ebuilder_init() != SUCCESS) {
01172     cm_disconnect_experiment();
01173     /* let user read message before window might close */
01174     ss_sleep(5000);
01175     goto exit;
01176   }
01177 
01178   /* Register single equipment */
01179   status = register_equipment();
01180   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01181     ss_sleep(5000);
01182     goto exit;
01183   }
01184 
01185   /* Load Fragment info */
01186   status = load_fragment();
01187   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01188     ss_sleep(5000);
01189     goto exit;
01190   }
01191 
01192   /* Register transition for reset counters */
01193   if (cm_register_transition(TR_START, tr_start, 300) != CM_SUCCESS)
01194     return status;
01195   if (cm_register_transition(TR_STOP, tr_stop, 700) != CM_SUCCESS)
01196     goto exit;
01197 
01198   /* Scan fragments... will stay in */
01199   status = scan_fragment();
01200   printf("%s-Out of scan_fragment\n", full_frontend_name);
01201 
01202   /* Detach all source from midas */
01203   printf("%s-Unbooking\n", full_frontend_name);
01204   source_unbooking();
01205   
01206   ebuilder_exit();
01207 
01208 exit:
01209   /* Free local memory */
01210   free_event_buffer(ebset.nfragment);
01211 
01212   /* Clean disconnect from midas */
01213   cm_disconnect_experiment();
01214   return 0;
01215 }
